title: ## Reading List: Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Processing (2022 and Earlier
This list provides a mix of foundational and recent works, covering both theoretical aspects and practical applications of self-supervised learning in speech processing
**"Representation Learning: A Review and New Perspectives"** by Yoshua Bengio et al
- A comprehensive overview of representation learning, including self-supervised methods
Unsupervised Learning, and Deep Architectures"** by Yoshua Bengio
- Introduces the concept of autoencoders for unsupervised feature learning
**"A Neural Probabilistic Language Model"** by Yoshua Bengio et al
- A seminal work on language modeling using neural networks, laying the groundwork for self-supervised learning in NLP
**"Learning Deep Representations for Image Recognition"** by Alex Krizhevsky et al
- Demonstrates the power of deep learning for image recognition, using supervised learning
**"Deep Neural Networks for Acoustic Modeling in Speech Recognition"** by Geoffrey Hinton et al
- Introduces deep neural networks for acoustic modeling in speech recognition, paving the way for self-supervised methods
**Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Representation:**
Contrastive Predictive Coding"** by Aaron van den Oord et al
- Introduces contrastive predictive coding, a powerful self-supervised learning framework for learning representations
Unsupervised Pre-training for Speech Recognition"** by Alexei Baevski et al
- Proposes wav2vec, a self-supervised model for speech representation learning using contrastive learning
Self-Supervised Speech Recognition with a Masked Acoustic Model"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Introduces HuBERT, a self-supervised model that leverages masked acoustic modeling for speech representation learning
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Recognition: A Comprehensive Survey"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- A comprehensive survey of self-supervised learning methods for speech recognition
**"MoCo: Momentum Contrast for Unsupervised Visual Representation Learning"** by Kaiming He et al
- Introduces MoCo, a momentum contrastive learning method for visual representation learning, applicable to speech
**"SimCLR: A Simple Framework for Contrastive Learning of Visual Representations"** by Ting Chen et al
- Proposes SimCLR, a simple contrastive learning framework for visual representations, adaptable to speech
**Tasks Enabling Self-Supervised Learning:**
**"Speech Recognition with Deep Recurrent Neural Networks"** by Alex Graves et al
- Introduces deep recurrent neural networks for speech recognition, enabling self-supervised learning through acoustic modeling
**"Deep Speech 2: End-to-End Speech Recognition in English and Mandarin"** by Baidu Research
- Demonstrates the effectiveness of end-to-end speech recognition using deep neural networks, paving the way for self-supervised learning
**"Speech Separation Using Deep Neural Networks"** by Yoshua Bengio et al
- Introduces deep neural networks for speech separation, enabling self-supervised learning through source separation tasks
**"Speech Enhancement Using Deep Neural Networks"** by Yannis Panagakis et al
- Explores the use of deep neural networks for speech enhancement, enabling self-supervised learning through noise reduction tasks
**"Speech Emotion Recognition Using Deep Learning: A Review"** by Muhammad Imran et al
- Reviews the use of deep learning for speech emotion recognition, highlighting the potential for self-supervised learning
**"Speaker Verification Using Deep Neural Networks"** by Dong Yu et al
- Introduces deep neural networks for speaker verification, enabling self-supervised learning through speaker identification tasks
**"Speech Synthesis Using Deep Learning: A Review"** by Heiga Zen et al
- Reviews the use of deep learning for speech synthesis, highlighting the potential for self-supervised learning
**"Zero-Shot Speech Recognition: A Survey"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Explores zero-shot speech recognition, a task that benefits from self-supervised learning for generalization
**"Speech Translation with Deep Learning: A Review"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Reviews the use of deep learning for speech translation, highlighting the potential for self-supervised learning
**Note:** This list is not exhaustive and there are many other relevant articles published in the field. It is recommended to explore further based on your specific interests and research needs
